answers.answer: Hi there.  This is rather non-specific findings, but this may mean that there is something blocking or affecting the blood flow inside the blood vessels of the brain.  These are most commonly due to blood vessel wall thickening or clots which may  be brought about by conditions like hypertension, diabetes, or high cholesterol levels.  I suggest you have yourself checked for these possible conditions.  Regards.

question: I had a mri of the brain without contrast and it stated that there are flow voids identified in the anterior and posterior circulations - I wondered what exactly this means
title: MRI of brain
